item.title: 美国指责 Visa 垄断借记卡刷卡业务
item.description: 美国司法部周二起诉 Visa 涉嫌违反反垄断法，指控这家全球最大的支付网络之一以高额费用威胁商户并收买潜在竞争对手，从而压制竞争。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice sued Visa for alleged antitrust violations on Tuesday, accusing one of the world's largest payment networks of suppressing competition by threatening merchants with high fees and paying off potential rivals.】

item.title: 微软将在墨西哥斥资 13 亿美元开发云计算和人工智能技术
item.description: 科技巨头微软公司周二宣布，将在未来三年内投资 13 亿美元，在墨西哥建设云计算和人工智能基础设施。【原文：Tech giant Microsoft will invest $1.3 billion over the next three years to build up its infrastructure in Mexico for cloud computing and artificial intelligence, the company announced on Tuesday.】

item.title: 埃利奥特将召集西南航空股东召开特别会议，以实现领导层更迭
item.description: 激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）周二升级了与美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）的董事会争斗，称其计划最快于下周召开特别股东大会，以彻底改革该航空公司的领导层。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management on Tuesday escalated its boardroom battle with Southwest Airlines , saying it plans to call a special shareholder meeting as soon as next week to overhaul the airline's leadership.】

item.title: 欧佩克发布 2050 年全球石油展望，认为需求不会达到顶峰
item.description: 欧佩克在一份年度展望报告中上调了对世界中长期石油需求的预测，理由是印度、非洲和中东地区的石油需求增长，以及向电动汽车和更清洁燃料的转变速度放缓。【原文：OPEC raised its forecasts for world oil demand for the medium and long term in an annual outlook, citing growth led by India, Africa and the Middle East and a slower shift to electric vehicles and cleaner fuels.】

item.title: 美国证交会指控 Foot Locker 前高级主管内幕交易
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周二指控一名前 Foot Locker 高管涉嫌内幕交易，称他在 2023 年两次公布财报前卖空了该零售商的股票。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charged a former Foot Locker executive on Tuesday with insider trading, saying he sold short the retailer's stock prior to two earnings announcements in 2023.】

item.title: 美国法官支持挑战堕胎法规的天主教雇主
item.description: 一名美国法官阻止了联邦机构执行乔-拜登总统政府制定的一项规定，该规定要求雇主为堕胎或接受某些生育治疗的员工提供便利，该规定针对的是一个全国性天主教商业协会的成员。【原文：A U.S. judge has blocked a federal agency from enforcing a rule crafted by President Joe Biden's administration requiring employers to accommodate employees who have abortions or undergo certain fertility treatments against members of a nationwide Catholic business association.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克和 X 公司寻求驳回唐-莱蒙因取消合作而提起的诉讼
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）和 X 公司要求联邦法官驳回 CNN 前主播唐-莱蒙（Don Lemon）的诉讼，唐-莱蒙声称他们在一次有争议的采访后取消了在社交媒体平台上的合作，从而欺骗了他。【原文：Elon Musk and X asked a federal judge to dismiss former CNN anchor Don Lemon's lawsuit claiming they defrauded him by canceling a partnership on the social media platform following a contentious interview.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会就垃圾收费和成本问题与 Invitation Homes 达成 4800 万美元的和解协议
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周二表示，美国最大的独户住宅房东 Invitation Homes 将支付 4800 多万美元，作为在租赁费用方面欺骗租户和收取未披露垃圾费的和解令的一部分。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Tuesday said Invitation Homes , the largest landlord of single-family homes in the United States, would pay more than $48 million as part of a settlement order over deceiving renters about lease costs and charging undisclosed junk fees.】

item.title: 华平投资 4,500 万美元出售股份，退出印度 CarTrade Tech 公司
item.description: 根据印度证券交易所（NSE）的数据，美国私募股权公司华平投资集团（Warburg Pincus）旗下部门周二通过大宗交易出售了其持有的印度汽车门户网站 CarTrade Tech 的全部 8.6% 股份，价值 37.5 亿卢比（约合 4486 万美元）。【原文：U.S.-based private equity firm Warburg Pincus's unit sold its entire 8.6% stake in Indian automobile portal CarTrade Tech on Tuesday through a bulk deal worth 3.75 billion rupees ($44.86 million), according to NSE data.】

item.title: 檀香山全球最大希尔顿酒店数千名员工罢工
item.description: 据希尔顿全球控股公司（Hilton Worldwide Holdings）旗下全球最大的酒店工会（Unite Here Union）称，由于合同谈判陷入僵局，本周二约有 2000 名酒店员工离职。【原文：Around 2,000 hotel workers walked off the job on Tuesday at Hilton Worldwide Holdings' largest hotel in the world as contract negotiations stalled, according to the Unite Here Union.】

item.title: 中国政府推出新刺激措施，中国 ADR、矿商和赌场股大涨
item.description: 周二，在美国上市的中国公司股票以及以中国为重点的交易所交易基金、赌场公司和与大宗商品相关的股票纷纷上扬，原因是中国政府采取了自大流行病以来最大规模的刺激措施，使人们对恢复增长产生了希望。【原文：U.S.-listed shares of Chinese firms jumped on Tuesday, along with China-focused exchange-traded funds, casino companies and commodity-linked stocks, as Beijing's largest stimulus measures since the pandemic raised hopes of renewed growth.】

item.title: 德国态度强硬，但阻止裕信银行向德国商业银行挺进的余地有限
item.description: 联合信贷银行首席执行官安德里亚-奥塞尔（Andrea Orcel）成功地将德国政界人士团结起来，反对他入股德国第二大银行--德国商业银行（Commerzbank）。【原文：UniCredit Chief Executive Andrea Orcel has succeeded in uniting Germany's political establishment in opposition to his stakebuilding in Commerzbank , the country's second largest lender.】

item.title: 各国领导人在联合国会议期间重点讨论可再生能源问题
item.description: 本周二，一个由全球最大的一些公司、金融机构和城市组成的联盟敦促各国政府采取相关政策，他们认为这些政策可以在2030年前释放出高达1万亿美元的清洁能源投资。【原文：A coalition of some of the world's biggest companies, finance houses and cities urged governments on Tuesday to adopt policies that they said could unleash up $1 trillion in clean energy investments by 2030.】

item.title: 麦格理将以高达 17.3 亿美元的价格收购 D.E. Shaw 绿色能源部门的少数股权
item.description: 麦格理集团（Macquarie Group）资产管理部门周二表示，该澳大利亚公司将以高达 17.3 亿美元的股权投资获得美国投资者 D.E. Shaw 旗下绿色能源部门的少数股权。【原文：Macquarie Group's asset management division is taking a minority stake in the green-energy arm of U.S. investor D.E. Shaw for an equity investment of as much as $1.73 billion, the Australian company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 大多数银行预计黄金牛市将持续到 2025 年
item.description: 由于交易所交易基金（ETF）的大量资金流入复苏，以及包括美国联邦储备委员会在内的全球主要央行将进一步降息的预期，各大银行预计黄金价格的破纪录涨势将延续到2025年。【原文：Major banks expect gold to extend its record-breaking price rally into 2025 because of a revival in large inflows to exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and expectations of additional interest rate cuts from prominent central banks around the world, including the U.S. Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司开始在美国进行第二阶段裁员，内部备忘录如是说
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，随着媒体巨头努力提高盈利能力，派拉蒙全球公司已开始在美国实施第二阶段的裁员计划。【原文：Paramount Global has begun the second phase of its planned layoffs in the United States as the media giant pushes toward increasing profitability, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: FAA 称波音安全文化改革可能需要数年时间
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局局长周二告诉美国众议院小组委员会，波音公司的安全文化改进工作可能需要三到五年才能完成。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration told a U.S. House subcommittee Tuesday that safety culture improvements at Boeing may take three to five years to complete.】

item.title: 穆迪称美国下届政府的财政状况将趋于恶化
item.description: 据评级机构穆迪（Moody's）称，由于政治两极分化，任何新总统政府都很难就减轻国债负担所需的措施进行谈判，美国的财政健康状况预计将进一步恶化。【原文：U.S. fiscal health is expected to deteriorate further as political polarization makes it hard for any new presidential administration to negotiate steps needed to reduce the national debt burden, according to ratings agency Moody's.】

item.title: 受劳动力市场担忧影响，美国 9 月消费者信心下滑
item.description: 由于对劳动力市场健康状况的担忧日益加剧，9月份美国消费者信心意外下降。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly fell in September amid mounting worries over the health of the labor market.】

item.title: Brightmine 称，英国雇主的加薪幅度是 2022 年 6 月以来最低的
item.description: 人力资源数据公司Brightmine周二公布的数据显示，在截至8月底的三个月里，英国雇主给员工的加薪幅度创下了自2022年6月以来的新低，加薪幅度中位数为4%。【原文：British employers gave staff the joint-lowest pay rises since June 2022 in the three months to the end of August, offering a median raise of 4%, figures from human resources data company Brightmine showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: Visa 因美国司法部指控借记卡垄断的诉讼报告而下跌
item.description: 有报道称，美国司法部计划对这家全球最大的支付处理商提起诉讼，指控其非法垄断美国借记卡市场，Visa 公司股价周二下跌 3%。【原文：Visa shares fell 3% on Tuesday after a report said the U.S. Department of Justice plans to file a lawsuit against the world's largest payment processor, alleging it illegally monopolized the country's debit-card market.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，随着保留汇丰银行员工的承诺接近尾声，加拿大皇家银行的银行家们担心裁员
item.description: 据六位熟悉情况的消息人士透露，加拿大皇家银行的一些员工是在汇丰银行加拿大分行被收购后加入该行的，他们担心在本月为期六个月的担保期到期后会失去工作。【原文：Some Royal Bank of Canada employees who joined as part of an HSBC Canada acquisition are worried about losing their jobs when a six-month guarantee expires this month, according to six sources familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 西方 ETF 投资者准备为黄金创纪录的涨势火上浇油
item.description: 分析师说，未来几个月黄金交易所交易基金的资金流入量，特别是来自西方投资者的资金流入量将增加，这将为已经创下历史新高的金银价格增添更多的利好刺激。【原文：Inflows into gold exchange-traded funds, particularly from Western investors, are set to rise in coming months, adding yet more positive stimulus for already record high bullion prices, analysts said.】

item.title: Vista Outdoor 推迟股东大会，再次就南玻交易进行表决
item.description: Vista Outdoor 再次推迟召开特别股东大会，就捷克斯洛伐克集团（CSG）21.5 亿美元收购该公司弹药部门及其户外部门股份的报价进行投票。【原文：Vista Outdoor has again delayed a special shareholder meeting to vote on Czechoslovak Group's (CSG) $2.15 billion offer for the firm's ammunition unit and a stake in its outdoor division.】

item.title: 汽车之家因成本上升季度利润不及预期；股价下跌
item.description: 汽车零部件零售商 AutoZone 周二公布的第四季度利润低于预期，受到通胀挑战的影响，其股价在早盘交易中下跌近 5%。【原文：Auto parts retailer AutoZone reported a lower-than-expected fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, hurt by inflationary challenges, sending its shares down almost 5% in early trade.】

item.title: 英国竞争监管机构将与谷歌合作解决有关 Chrome 浏览器 cookies 的问题
item.description: 英国竞争监督机构周二表示，将与 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司合作解决竞争问题，因为该机构发现，谷歌对 Chrome 浏览器上的第三方 cookie 所采取的修订方法仍会引发广告市场的担忧。【原文：UK's Competition watchdog said on Tuesday it would work with Alphabet-owned Google to address competition concerns after it found the company's revised approach towards third-party cookies on Chrome still raised concerns in the advertising market.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会对 11 家违反记录保存规定的公司处以超过 880 万美元的罚款
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周二宣布，11 家经纪自营商和投资顾问已同意支付超过 8800 万美元的罚款，以解决他们未能妥善保存电子通信记录的指控，这是美国监管机构在一系列此类执法行动中的最新一次。【原文：Eleven broker-dealers and investment advisers have agreed to pay fines of more than $88 million to resolve allegations they failed to keep proper records of electronic communications, U.S. regulators' latest in a series of such enforcement actions, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission announced Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普为迁往美国的企业提供税收减免和较少的监管措施
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普在 11 月 5 日的大选中获胜，他将提出一系列鼓励外国公司迁往美国的优惠政策，包括低税收和少监管。【原文：Donald Trump offered a series of incentives to encourage foreign companies to relocate to the United States if he wins the Nov. 5 election, including low taxes and few regulations.】

item.title: 马斯克说他的公司正寻求在阿根廷投资
item.description: 特斯拉和 SpaceX 公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周二在 X 上发帖说，他的公司正在寻找投资阿根廷和支持这个南美国家的途径。【原文：Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, said in an X post on Tuesday that his companies are looking for ways to invest in Argentina and support the South American nation.】

item.title: Vista、Blackstone 将以 84 亿美元收购 Smartsheet，这是今年最大的私有化交易之一
item.description: 收购公司 Vista Equity Partners 和 Blackstone 周二表示，将以 84 亿美元收购协作软件制造商 Smartsheet，这是今年最大的私有化交易之一。【原文：Buyout firms Vista Equity Partners and Blackstone will purchase collaboration-software maker Smartsheet for $8.4 bln in one of the largest take-private deals this year, the companies said on Tuesday.】
